meanings.definition: A type of enzyme that breaks down proteins in cells.
meanings.sent1: The cathepsin helped to break down the proteins in the cell.
meanings.sent2: Scientists studied the cathepsin to understand how it breaks down proteins.
meanings.sent3: The cathepsin in the cell had a party, breaking down proteins with enthusiasm.
meanings.sent4: Like a tiny key, the cathepsin unlocked the proteins in the cell.
meanings.sent5: The cathepsin worked tirelessly, like a little protein-eating machine.

meanings.definition: Any of a group of proteolytic enzymes found in many tissues and cells.
meanings.sent1: Researchers discovered various cathepsins in different tissues and cells.
meanings.sent2: The cathepsin group plays a crucial role in breaking down proteins in the body.
meanings.sent3: At the enzyme party, the cathepsins were the life of the proteolytic dance floor.
meanings.sent4: The cathepsins acted like a team of tiny protein ninjas, silently breaking down molecules.
meanings.sent5: In the world of enzymes, the cathepsins were the silent but efficient cleaners.
